title: On a new hard drive, all old emails are bolded as "unread."
content: My husband recently replaced the hard drive on his laptop. On Thunderbird, all his old emails--thousands of them--are bolded, as if unread. New emails are fine. When he reads them, they unbold correctly. Has Thunderbird permanently forgotten which of the old emails in his Inbox have been read and which have not? Is there any way to correct this aside from scrolling through them one by one and unbolding the ones he's read? Thanks!

title: When awakened from PC sleep Thunderbird shows 'could not connect'
content:
With Thunderbird running, I will often put my PC in sleep mode. When I wake it up some time later, Thunderbird shows 'could not connect'. A click on 'Get messages' then behaves normally. 

I presume that it has not given time for something to start up before sending an 'are you there' request. How can I avoid this irritant?

This does not happen if I go to sleep mode and then awaken in a few seconds.

Settings Get messages at startup. 

  and       Check every 10 minutes

title: Installed to later version of Thunderbird; now its authentication with RoadRunner Email fails.
content:
Was using a version in the 90's, then updated Thunderbird to 102.14.0. I can open Thunderbird, but I can no longer access my RoadRunner Email. 

I get the error message "The server does not support the selected authentication method. Please change the 'Authentication method' "  Nothing in the updated versions PW settings seems to have changed.

I even verified I could access my RR Email directly online with Firefox. T-Bird has the *same exact PW* listed in my Firefox, so then I edited it to the same, just to see if a subsequent PW updating would be consistent with the T-Bird update.

Please help, otherwise I will have to reinstall T-Bird back to the earlier version. This is exactly why I avoid updates.

title: SMTP server timing out (smtp.office365.com) sometimes...
content:
Hi all,

I've been experiencing an issue for the past 8 weeks after the organization have migrated to Office 365.

I've tried all the steps listed in this article, https://support.mozilla.org/bm/kb/cannot-send-messages#w_if-this-list-..., "Cannot send messages". Tips include removing account and adding it again, deleting SMTP password, trying both ports 587 and 465, and of course verifying my SMTP outgoing email settings multiple times.

The issue is, sometimes it works perfectly fine to send e-mails. Sometimes it doesn't - it can take up to 5-10 secs for the e-mail to be sent.

I've also tried:

1) Increasing Server Timeout Value in the Config Editor 2) Disabled Anti-virus briefly to find that the issue was still there

This is the e-mail box that is showing: https://bilddump.se/bilder/20230815112202-84.55.121.202.png

This is my Office365 SMTP settings: https://bilddump.se/bilder/20230815112041-84.55.121.202.png

Questions:

- Is anyone else experiencing issues sending e-mails with Office365 smtp settings? - Before migrating to Office365, sending e-mails was super quick. Now, it takes 2-5 secs for each e-mail to be sent. However, SOMETIMES, it sends super quick... How come? - Does Office365 have general issues with Thunderbird? Using other e-mail clients such as Spark+ our Outlook doesn't give this issue, but I really want to use Thunderbird as it's been my go-to email client for multiple years

Hoping for a resolution... if anyone has experience with TB and Office365 having this issue, happy for any tips to try so I can start sending emails quick again.
creator: alexander85

title: Problems trying to un-ignore a thread
content:
Hello! I accidentally hit 'K' with a thread selected, and so got a message at the bottom of the screen saying that replies to the thread will not be shown. This is the same situation as in the now-archived question [[Accidentally pressed "K" on an email - can no longer find it|https://support.mozilla.org/bm/questions/1380096]].

I'm now writing because I *was* able to select the option to display ignored threads described in the reply to the question above – so that I can, at least, now see the thread that I accidentally ignored without meaning to. But I'd like to actually fix the problem and un-ignore it.

I've read the support article on Ignoring Threads, but what that article describes – namely applying 'Ignore' to the same thread so that it toggles off to unignore the thread – isn't working. I also tried quitting Thunderbird entirely after doing that and then reopening it, but I can still only see the thread if 'view' is set to still display ignored threads; when I remove that view instruction, the thread disappears again.

Does anyone know if there's something else I should try? Or is this maybe a bug in Thunderbird that needs to be fixed? Thanks so much in advance!
creator: linegrandfather
